epic.description_text:
User Value: Users can create and manage isolated project instances with clear navigation

Description: Implements the core project management infrastructure, allowing analysts to create projects, switch between them, and work within isolated project workspaces. Each project is a completely isolated instance with its own data room, knowledge base, and deliverables.

Functional Requirements Covered:
- FR-ARCH-001: Platform-Agent Separation
- FR-ARCH-002: Tool-Based Agent Integration
- FR-ARCH-003: Scalable Service Architecture

UX Screens:
- Projects Overview (Landing)
- Project Workspace Shell
- Top Navigation Bar
- Sidebar Navigation

Technical Foundation:
- Next.js 15 app structure (React 19.2, Turbopack beta)
- Supabase Auth setup
- PostgreSQL 18 schema (deals table)
- RLS policies for data isolation
- Docker Compose development environment

Acceptance Criteria (Epic Level):
- User can create new project with basic metadata
- User can see all their projects in overview
- User can switch between projects
- Each project workspace shows project-specific data only
- Data is completely isolated per project (RLS enforced)

stories.summary: E1.1: Set up Next.js 15 Project with shadcn/ui and Tailwind CSS 4
stories.user_story:
As a developer
I want a properly configured Next.js 15 project with shadcn/ui and Tailwind CSS 4
So that I have the foundation for building the frontend
stories.description: Initialize the Next.js 15 project with App Router, configure Tailwind CSS 4, install and configure shadcn/ui components, and set up the base project structure.
key_acceptance_criteria: Next.js 15 project initialized with App Router
shadcn/ui installed with 5+ base components (Button, Input, Card, Badge, Label)

stories.summary: E1.2: Configure Supabase Auth and Database Connection
stories.user_story:
As a developer
I want Supabase authentication and database configured
So that users can securely authenticate and access project data
stories.description: Set up Supabase project, configure authentication providers (email/password, magic links), establish database connection, and implement Row-Level Security (RLS) policies for multi-tenant data isolation.

stories.summary: E1.3: Create PostgreSQL Schema with RLS Policies
stories.user_story:
As a developer
I want the complete PostgreSQL schema with RLS policies
So that project data is structured and secured
stories.description: Create all PostgreSQL tables (deals, documents, findings, insights, conversations, messages, irls, qa_lists, cims) with proper indexes, foreign keys, and Row-Level Security policies to ensure complete data isolation per user.

stories.user_story:
As an M&A analyst
I want to see all my projects in a clear overview
So that I can quickly access the project I'm working on
stories.description: Implement the Projects Overview landing screen with card grid and table views, showing project metadata, status, progress indicators, and quick actions. This is the first screen users see after login.
key_acceptance_criteria: Card grid view displays all user's projects

stories.user_story:
As an M&A analyst
I want to create a new project through a guided wizard
So that I can quickly set up a project with the right configuration
stories.description: Build a 3-step project creation wizard that guides users through project setup: basics (name, company, industry), project type selection, and IRL template selection. Upon completion, redirect to the new project's dashboard.
key_acceptance_criteria: Deal created in database on completion

stories.summary: E1.6: Build Project Workspace Shell with Navigation
stories.user_story:
As an M&A analyst
I want a consistent workspace layout when I enter a project
So that I can easily navigate between project areas
stories.description: Create the Project Workspace shell with top navigation bar (showing project name, status, notifications) and sidebar navigation (Dashboard, Data Room, Knowledge Explorer, Chat, Deliverables). This provides the container for all project-specific screens.

stories.user_story:
As a developer
I want Neo4j graph database configured and connected
So that the system can store knowledge graph relationships for cross-domain analysis
stories.description: Set up Neo4j graph database instance (local for dev, cloud for production), define node and relationship schemas for knowledge graph, configure connection from backend, and implement basic health checks.
key_acceptance_criteria: Neo4j instance running (Docker Compose or AuraDB)
Node schemas documented (Deal, Document, Finding, Insight)

stories.user_story:
As a developer
I want pg-boss job queue configured
So that the system can process documents asynchronously in the background
stories.description: Set up pg-boss (PostgreSQL-based job queue) for background processing of document parsing, analysis, and knowledge base updates. Configure job types, workers, and monitoring.

stories.summary: E1.9: Implement Audit Logging for Security Events
stories.user_story:
As a security administrator
I want all security-relevant events logged
So that I can track access, changes, and potential security incidents
stories.description: Implement comprehensive audit logging for authentication, authorization, data access, and modifications. Store audit logs in dedicated table with tamper-proof design.
key_acceptance_criteria: API to query audit logs (admin only)

story_dependencies.notes: Stories can be worked in parallel, but logical dependency order:
sequence: E1.1 (Next.js setup) should be done first
E1.2 (Supabase Auth) and E1.3 (PostgreSQL Schema) can run in parallel after E1.1
E1.4, E1.5, E1.6 (UI components) depend on E1.1, E1.2, E1.3
E1.7 (Neo4j), E1.8 (pg-boss), E1.9 (Audit Logging) can run in parallel
